content.title: Scheme for Plantation Development (New planting & Replanting) under Medium Term Framework Plan (MTFP) in Traditional Areas (Kerala and Tamil Nadu), Non-Traditional and North Eastern Region
content.details: The Scheme is intended to increase the production of natural rubber in India by accelerating new planting and replanting of rubber on scientific lines. Accelerated new planting/replanting would be achieved by giving proper technical guidance and financial assistance to growers.
benefits: Traditional Region: ₹ 20,000/- ha + ₹ 5,000 /ha for planting material (Polybag/ Root trainer plants) of advanced growth.
SC Category: ₹ 35,000/- ha + ₹ 5,000 /ha for planting material (Polybag/ Root trainer plants) of advanced growth.
Non-Traditional and North Eastern Region: ₹ 35,000 per ha and ₹ 5,000/ ha for planting material (Polybag/ Root trainer plants) of advanced growth.
eligibility: Traditional: Growers owning rubber areas not exceeding 2.00 ha.
Non-Traditional: Growers owning rubber areas not exceeding 5.00 ha.
Minimum area for new planting/replanting rubber is 0.10 ha.
Applicant must have absolute possession over the land.
Paddy fields are not eligible for assistance.
content.application_process: Online application through the ServicePlus Portal.
documents_required: Identity Proof (Voter ID, PAN, Driving Licence, Passport)
Photocopy of bank passbook showing name of the Account holder, account number and IFS Code of Bank
Valid Certificate from Village Officer to prove ownership of the total rubber area owned by the applicant
Sketch of the applied area showing descriptions of boundary on all sides with names of the owners
Bill of Planting Material purchased (self-declaration for certain years)
Nomination, if applicable (in case of joint ownership/ minor owner)
Caste Certificate (in the case of SC Applicants)
PAH Declaration Form (in the case of PAH)

faqs.question: Is it mandatory to provide the bill of planting material for certain years?
faqs.answer: For plantations in 2018, 2019, 2020, and 2021, the bill of planting material is not mandatory. Instead, a self-declaration containing purchase details is to be uploaded.

faqs.question: When is a nomination required in the application?
faqs.answer: A nomination is required in case of joint ownership or minor ownership.

faqs.question: Are there any specific requirements for SC applicants in terms of documents?
faqs.answer: SC applicants are required to provide a caste certificate as part of the application.

faqs.question: Is there a requirement to provide a sketch of the applied area?
faqs.answer: Yes, a sketch of the applied area is required, showing descriptions of boundaries on all sides with the names of the owners.

faqs.question: How is ownership of the rubber area proven in the application?
faqs.answer: Ownership is established by providing a valid certificate from the Village Officer.

faqs.question: What kind of identity proof is preferred for the application?
faqs.answer: Preferred identity proof documents include Voter ID, PAN card, Driving Licence, or Passport.
